alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Frederick; Howard; Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 06 at 5:37AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Maryland and north central Maryland, including the following counties: in central Maryland, Howard and Montgomery. In north central Maryland, Carroll and Frederick. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect areas of slow moving or standing water in poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 532 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain that is resulting 1 to 1.5 inches per hour. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Germantown... Frederick... Rockville... Gaithersburg... Leesburg... Olney... Westminster... Damascus... Lowes Island... Poolesville... Aspen Hill... Potomac... North Bethesda... Montgomery Village... North Potomac... Ballenger Creek... Redland... Great Falls... Mount Airy... Walkersville... - For safety information visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
